info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 15 at 2:19PM EDT until August 15 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Elbert County in northeastern Georgia... Southwestern Abbeville County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 219 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles east of Elberton, or near Lake Russell, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Calhoun Falls, Lowndesville, Bobby Brown State Park, Lake Strom Thurmond, Russell State Park, Nancy Hart State Park, Middleton, Lake Russell, Rice Town and Bobby Brown State Recreation Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
